title: Great app!
comment: This is Android development done right. A free open source version without ads, minimal permissions, nicely polished UI, and in the paid version, some great added features. My favorite is having alarms. Many don't know that fully charging Li-Ion batteries (especially keeping them at full charge) shortens their life. This app lets you set an alarm to unplug your device when it gets nearly full (say 90%). For devices with the battery sealed inside that's a big deal as it can help the battery last a lot longer. It's also great to warn you to plug in that old tablet you don't use very often before the battery goes completely dead which also shortens the battery life. Nice work!

title: Bug-fixed Just in Time!
comment: My phone batteries go flat quite rapidly after dropping below 50% charge, so I upgraded to this pro version last week (from the ever-reliable free version) in order to benefit from its low battery alarms & different icon warning colours. First Problem : the red coloured icon can't be set above 30% which is way too low for my needs. The dev's explanation for this is that too many choices of level will increase app size, so it's just unfortunate for me that he chose to provide TOO MANY choices below 30% (25,20,15,10,5) but NONE above 30%. Same problem for the amber icon, which only goes to 50%. I found a work-around for this. Just install the "Classic" plugin, which lets you choose from a wide range of charge levels for the different icon colours. Second Problem : unfortunately, I later discovered that the audible low battery alarms (vital for when my phone display is off) never worked properly while the plugins were being used. Arghh! So I gained nothing by going Pro.....TILL NOW! The latest bug-fix has come in the nick of time. Everything works nicely now, even if I do still have to choose the Plugin mode. Just 1 wish : an option to have the app calc. the usage times instead of me.
